ovdesc.p: This table contains the details of the safecustody charges and management fee structures to be levied on each portfolio when the charges module is run.

Specifies whether clients accounts are to be automatically debited with safe custody or advisory charges.

Safekeeping and Advisory Charges are posted to customer accounts only when T24 has been specifically requested to do so. This method gives the Custodian and Account Officers an opportunity to review the system calculated fees prior to their being posted to the clients financial accounts.
This field is used in conjunction with the VALUE.DATE field, which specifies the value date for the accouting entries.
If this field is YES when the fees are calculated then the clients accounts will be automatically debited during the next COB with the charges before the production of the respective report.

If this field is NO or blank when fees are calculated then the clients accounts will only be updated when either the online service is run or this field together with the VALUE DATE field are set up then the COB run will post the accounting entries.
The online services are for Safekeeping fees SC.SAFE.FEES.POST and for Management fees SC.ADV.FEES.POST.
Only Y(es) or N(o) or blank allowed.

This field is associated with the CHARGE.TYPE field. The field indicates whether or not the system will perform an extract to the corresponding extract files SC.ASSET.BAL or SAFECUSTODY.EXTRACT on a daily basis or not. If the field is set to YES then the system will perform the extract on the day the portfolio moves in the security. If the field is set to NO then the system will perform the extract only at the month end. In order for the system to be able to calculate the charges based on the months average balance the extract needs to be performed on a daily basis. This means that this field cannot be set back to NO from a YES if any of the SCPM/SCSF.CHARGE.PARAMETER records have the field AVERAGE.CLOSING set to a value of MONTH.AVERAGE
Valid values of YES or NO
Cannot be set back to NO from a YES if any of the SCPM/SCSF.CHARGE.PARAMETER records have the field AVERAGE.CLOSING set to a value of MONTH.AVERAGE
For Management Fees.
Controls whether to include portfolios for which there are no associated records in the file SC.ASSET.BAL.

If set to NO then portfolios which have been opened, but which do not yet have any positions, will be ignored by the fee processing jobs. Consequently they will not be subject to any minimum fee which may have been defined via the applications FT.COMMISSION.TYPE or SCPM.GROUP.CONDITION. For the MONTHLY fee accrual method, this is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field.

If set to YES then portfolios which have been opened, but which do not yet have any positions, will be included by the fee processing jobs. Consequently they will be subject to any minimum fee which may have been defined in the aforementioned applications. For the DAILY fee accrual method, this is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field.
For Safe Custody Fees.
Controls whether to include portfolios for which there are no associated records in the file SAFECUSTODY.EXTRACT.

If set to NO then portfolios which have been opened, but which do not yet have any positions, will be ignored by the fee processing jobs. Consequently they will not be subject to any minimum fee which may have been defined via the applications FT.COMMISSION.TYPE or SCSK.GROUP.CONDITION. This is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field. For the MONTHLY fee accrual method, this is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field.

If set to YES then portfolios which have been opened, but which do not yet have any positions, will be included by the fee processing jobs. Consequently they will be subject to any minimum fee which may have been defined in the aforementioned applications. For the DAILY fee accrual method, this is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field.
If nothing is entered NO will be assumed.

Field allowing the user to specify the end date printed on any delivery produced by fees charged for the period type defined in the associated CALC.TYPE field.

This is done using the characters -,+,L,C and O together with numeric input where; O represents the date of the portfolio opening. L represents the date of the Last Fees Run. C represents todays system date.
Thus C-1 is the calendar date before today. O+1 is the calendar date after the opening date of the portfolio.
Only input of a number or the characters -,+,L,C or O allowed.

Field allowing the user to specify the start of the fee charging period for the period type defined in the associated CALC.TYPE field. This is done using the characters -,+,L,C and O together with numeric input where; O represents the date of the portfolio opening. L represents the date of the Last Fees Run. C represents todays system date.
Thus C-1 is the calendar date before today. O+1 is the calendar date after the opening date of the portfolio.

The safecustody fees system works on a month basis, so if the user wants to have the safecustody fees calculated from the last run date up and including the current date, input should be made as follows:
PERIOD.START L+1
PERIOD.END C

This is because of the monthly calculation. For example, if the current working date is 31/03/99 and the last run was done on 31/12/98 then the values of the variables are L = 199812 and C = 199903. As the system takes the last run date to be the first of the month, this translates a period.start of L and a period.end of C as the period 01/12/98 to 31/03/99 which is 4 months. Whereas the period.start of L+1 and a period.end of C gives a period of 01/01/99 to 31/03/99 and hence a period of 3 months.
Only input of a number or the characters -,+,L,C or O allowed.
Note that where PERFORM.ACCRUAL is set to DAILY this field is not referenced and the charge period for the SC and IC CHARGE.TYPE is assumed to commence one day after the portfolio start date.

Field allowing the user to specify the number of months in the period for the period type defined in the associated CALC.TYPE field. This is done using the characters -,+,L,C and O together with numeric input where; O represents the date of the portfolio opening. L represents the date of the Last Fees Run. C represents todays system date.
Thus C-1 is the calendar date before today. O+1 is the calendar date after the opening date of the portfolio.
e.g. for PERIODIC.NORMAL this field will typically contain C-L.
Only input of a number or the characters -,+,L,C or O allowed.

Multi-valued field associated with the CHARGE.TYPE field to indicate whether the fees are calculated on a Company Wide basis or at an individual portfolio basis.

The bank has a choice of defining a single fees calculation frequency on the SAFECUSTODY.VALUES record (in the CHARGE.FREQ field) for each type of fees or defining an individual fees frequency for each type of fees on the SEC.ACC.MASTER for each portfolio (using the SAFECUSTODY.FREQ and ADVISORY.FREQ fields) to which fees are to be charged.

If this field is set to Y then the SAFECUSTODY.FREQ and ADVISORY.FREQ fields on the SEC.ACC.MASTER application will be no input fields and will always be equal to the CHARGE.FREQ field from the SAFECUSTODY.VALUES record for the Company. Thus the calculation of Safecustody or Advisory Fees will take place for all the portfolios in the company on the same date.

If this field is set to NO then the user will have to input a charging frequency for each individual portfolio in the SAFECUSTODY.FREQ and ADVISORY.FREQ fields of the SEC.ACC.MASTER for each portfolio to which fees are to be charged.
Only input of Y or NO allowed.
Will default to Y.

Multi-valued field associated with the CHARGE.TYPE field to indicate whether fees are posted on a Company wide of individual portfolio basis.

The bank has the choice of using the POST.CHARGES flag on the SAFECUSTODY.VALUES application to post the outstanding fees charges for all portfolios in a single posting (during COB) or to use the applications SC.ADV.FEES.POST (for advisory fees) and SC.SAFE.FEES.POST (for Safecustody fees) to select which portfolios fees have been reviewed and are ready for posting.
If this field is set to Y then the posting will take place on a company wide basis.
If this field is set to NO then the posting of fees will take place on a portfolio by portfolio basis.
Only input of Y or NO allowed.

This field along with its associated sub-valued fields allow the user to specify the different date ranges for the four different types of date range that can occur when calculating Safecustody or Management Fees.
These four ranges are
PERIODIC.OPEN Used when the Charges run is an automatic charging run controlled by the frequency in the CHARGE.FREQ field and the portfolio was opened since the last automatic run.
PERIODIC.NORMAL Used when the charges run is an automatic charging controlled by the frequency in the CHARGE.FREQ field and the portfolio was open at the time of the last fee run.
CLOSURE.NORMAL Used when the fees are being calculated because a portfolio is being closed and the portfolio was open at the time of the last fees run.
CLOSURE.OPEN Used when the fees are being calculated because a portfolio is being closed and the portfolio has been opened since the last fee run.
Input must be PERIODIC.NORMAL, PERIODIC.OPEN, CLOSURE.NORMAL or CLOSURE.OPEN.
Mandatory Input.
Note that these fields relate to MONTHLY fee accrual and are not referenced where PERFORM.ACCRUAL is assigned to DAILY.

Controls whether to calculate fees for portfolios for which the charge basis amount is zero. The method of deriving the charge basis amount is controlled by the settings within SCPM.GROUP.CONDITION and SCPM.CHARGE.PARAMETER(For Management Fees) and SCSK.GROUP.CONDITION and SCSF.CHARGE.PARAMETER(For Safe Custody Fees). This parameter will also become relevant for flat positions, where all holdings for the relevant asset(s) have been sold.

If set to NO then no calculation will be performed where the charge basis amount is zero. As a consequence, any OVERALL.MIN.AMOUNT defined in the application FT.COMMISSION.TYPE will be disregarded. This is the default behaviour if no value is defined in this field.

If set to YES then a calculation will be performed for the relevant asset(s) where the charge basis amount is zero. As a consequence, any OVERALL.MIN.AMOUNT defined in the application FT.COMMISSION.TYPE will become effective.

Note that where the fee calculation method is set to TOTAL, then a single charge basis amount is calculated for all assets, whereas for the DETAIL method each asset is considered separately. The new parameter described here is referenced for both of these calculation methods.
If nothing is entered NO will be assumed.

Special note regarding portfolios with no positions: It will only be possible to impose a minimum fee via FT.COMMISSION.TYPE>OVERALL.MIN.AMOUNT in such cases for MONTHLY accrual where the calculation method defined on SCxx.GROUP.CONDITION is TOTAL. In this instance, the calculation will be performed using the TOT.COMM.CODE and TOT.PERCENT specified on SCxx.GROUP.CONDITION. If DETAIL method is specified then T24 will be unable to establish the required Commission Code/Percent where no assets at all are held. DAILY accrual does not support FT.COMMISSION.TYPE>OVERALL.MIN.AMOUNT functionality for such portfolios.
Enables to post Accruals of the child portfolios in the SC.FEE.GROUP under parent portfolio.

Multi value per charge type. The country code to be used either from SECURITY.MASTER or STOCK.EXCHANGE to identify the fee group of the asset.
If the value is set as SEC.DOM, Security Domicile from Security Master will be used to identify the fee group.
If the value is set as SEC.COM.DOM, Company Domicile from Security Master will be used to identify the fee group.
If the value is set as STK.DOM, Domicile from Stock Exchange linked to the security master will be used to identify the fee group.
Allowed values are SEC.DOM, SEC.COM.DOM, STK.DOM.
